intro: Hylocharis cyanocarpa, commonly known as the blue-fruited hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet-colored fruits. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Hylocharis cyanocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas.
